snippet: Twice convicted of N.F.L.-related frauds, Mike Ornstein has popped up in some of football’s most infamous moments, including the Saints’ bounty program and the Reggie Bush scandal at U.S.C.
abstract: NFL insider Mike Ornstein, twice convicted of professional football-related frauds, has popped up in some of football's most infamous moments, the latest being the New Orleans Saints bounty program. Photos (L)
lead_paragraph: The first e-mail was sent to New Orleans Saints Coach Sean Payton on Sept. 3 from the federal prison system's minimum-security camp in Florence, Colo. It promised $5,000 for Saints players who delivered hard hits on Green Bay Packers quarterback Aaron Rodgers in the N.F.L.'s season-opening game a few days later. The second message, sent a month later after the writer had been transferred to a halfway house, pledged $5,000 for hits on Carolina quarterback Cam Newton when the Saints faced the Panthers.
